module.name: security_classification
module.purpose: The Security classification application module supports the requirement to record the identification of the classification requirements for product data.

inscope.li: indicating product data has a security classification or is unclassified;
recording of a label indicating a standard security classification and applying it to product data;
specifying an alias for a security classification label;
recording of a label indicating a non-standard security classification with a description or the classification and what organization or person in organization is responsible for it;
recording of an optional date or date and time when a security classification was applied;
recording of an optional date or date and time when a security classification was removed;
recording of an optional approval for the application of the security classification to the product data.

outscope.li: all things which are not involved in the representation of security classification information and applying it to product data.

definition.def: identifies the classification level for which no security is necessary.
identifies the classification level for which security is necessary the type of protection needed is identified elsewhere.
identifies the classification level for which the disclosure of information about the part or the design of the part would risk an organization's market or competitive advantage.
identifies the classification level for which the disclosure of information about the part or the design of the part would cause damage to national or organizational security.
identifies the classification level for which the disclosure of information about the part or the design of the part would cause serious damage to national or organizational security.
identifies the classification level for which the disclosure of information about the part or the design of the part would cause exceptionally grave damage to national or organizational security.

description.p: The Security_Classification UoF specifies the definitional information for the concept of representing the security classification of product data.
